Pre-Game Insights: The toss will be crucial as both teams prefer different batting orders. South Africa loves to bat first, while India prefers having a target in front of them.
India's five-bowler strategy will be tested in this match, as they do not have a sixth bowling option in their regular XI.
South Africa has joined India in the semi-finals, and this match could be a dress rehearsal for the final.
Mohammed Shami and Quinton de Kock: Mohammed Shami has been in excellent form in the World Cup, picking up 14 wickets in just 3 matches.
Quinton de Kock is the leading run-scorer and century-maker in the tournament, with 545 runs and 4 centuries.
Team news: India is likely to field an unchanged XI, with KL Rahul now officially the vice-captain of the team.
South Africa might play both Keshav Maharaj and Tabraiz Shamsi, but the final decision will be made after seeing the pitch.
Pitch and conditions: The pitch at Eden Gardens hasn't really favored a particular type of bowling.
Dew could play a role in the second innings, as the temperature is expected to drop significantly at night.
Stats and trivia: Virat Kohli is one short of equaling Sachin Tendulkar's record of most ODI hundreds.
Among those who have bowled at least 15 overs in this World Cup, only two have economy rates under four: Jasprit Bumrah and Ravindra Jadeja.
Marco Jansen has picked up 12 wickets in the powerplay in this World Cup - the most by any bowler in that phase.
